page.title: 04HOUSES
page.content: Most of the houses in{Sherborne}and{ {Windrush}are built of Cotswold stone and many of them have Cotswold stone tiles on the roof.The tiles are small at the ridge and big at the eaves.The Cotswold stone was quarried from now disused quarries near by. Cotswold stone is very rough and cream in colour when it first comes out of the quarries.It is sawed and smoothed out to build houses.Some of the houses have concrete tiles and others have slates.Many cottages have dormer windows.These are windows that stick out from the roof.The Cotswold stone turns grey when it is older and blends into the landscape.
